instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: No internal Storage Recognition 820-3332-A but boots from Thunderbolt and USB
threads.message: Hi I have a Macbook Pro 15" 2012 Retina 820-3332-A.  It will boot from usb and thunderbolt and work perfectly but the internal PCIE drive just boot loops.  I've tested the PCIE drive on another Mac and it works perfectly.  I'm guessing the issue has to do with some data lines going to the Storage but before I start I'm hoping for some direction or if someone has readings for the data lines.  Or if someone has ran into this before.  Thx.

threads.title: No internal Storage Recognition 820-3332-A but boots from Thunderbolt and USB
threads.message: I would first confirm a known good SSD with a clean install. Never seen this issue before and it being a board problem.
